metadata.titel_preek: Face to Face, Hand in Hand

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in human history through the Resurrection of Jesus Christ to transform the 'man of dust' into the 'man of heaven,' overcoming the cosmic power of death.

tekstueel_bewijs: God has broken through from beyond human history
God gives it a body as he has chosen
Christ has been raised from the dead

object.identificatie: The Resurrection of the Body / Transformation of the Human State
tekstueel_bewijs: we shall also bear the image of the man of heaven

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Transcendent Order
tekstueel_bewijs: the single, definitive, and unique action of God
to all who received him... he gave power
our loved ones restored to us

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Apostolic Proclamation
tekstueel_bewijs: the evidence planted within human history

tegenstander.identificatie: Death, Sin, and the 'Spiritualizing' of Faith
tekstueel_bewijs: death is swallowed up in victory
the devil and his hosts destroyed
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not a moral failing but the ontological reality of death and the 'perishable' nature of flesh and blood.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer's response of faith and the resulting intimate relationship with the Risen Lord.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (believing) is entirely dependent on the primary program (God raising Christ). Faith is a 'grasping' of what God has already done.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has broken through from beyond human history
God gives it a body as he has chosen
He gave power to become children of God
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we shall also bear the image
we today may grasp by faith

voorbeelden: you need to know that if Christ has not been raised...
We don't seem to want to believe
We want to hold a warm hand
All things are possible with God
he gave power to become children of God

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Pouvoir' (Power) of God to do what is humanly impossible. It emphasizes human 'Non-Pouvoir' (inability) to save themselves.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Dust/Death) through ~S1 (the false comfort of 'spiritual' immortality) to the resolution in S1 (Resurrection).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God's 'breakthrough' from beyond history, which is not a natural development but a new creation.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; death is treated as a final, splaying, terrifying reality that only a miracle can solve.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor, and the 'Object' (Resurrection) is a gift that humans are incapable of producing or even imagining.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God has broken through from beyond human history
Death is swallowed up in victory

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (the women, Peter, Paul) are shown as witnesses or recipients of action, not as moral models to imitate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The women are models of 'trembling and astonishment' (passive reaction) rather than 'heroic faith'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the burden of 'doing' is replaced by the joy of 'receiving'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God does the work, man receives the benefit.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative hierarchy is perfectly maintained: the primary program of God's action establishes the possibility of the secondary program (human faith/love).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Death is swallowed up in victory; the devil and his hosts destroyed.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: Endowment of 'power to become children of God'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is linked to death and the 'man of dust' which cannot inherit the kingdom.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions God as the Subject of the narrative engine. The 'Object' is correctly identified as a gift of grace rather than a reward for effort.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it serves the Easter theme perfectly.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Death/Dust) is already sufficiently intensified.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in grace-oriented homiletics. It avoids the trap of turning the Resurrection into a 'spiritual' metaphor or a call to human action, keeping the focus squarely on the miraculous agency of God.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the 'face to face' metaphor, actantial analysis reveals that the 'face' is only possible because God (Subject) has overcome Death (Opponent).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains what Paul meant by 'spiritual body'; actantial analysis shows how the sermon uses that definition to strip the hearer of self-reliance.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas' model exposes that the 'immortality of the soul' is a narrative shortcut that removes the need for a Divine Subject, whereas 'resurrection' necessitates one.

volledige_object_lijst: The image of the man of heaven
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Internet relationship' analogy not as a moral imperative but as a signifier for the necessity of bodily presence, which God provides.
